fields.personal_interests: I enjoy reading, teaching, writing, theatre, dancing, improvisation, good food and wine with my husband, and my 2 3/4 cats.
fields.employment:
**Private Massage and Natural Health Practice, 2001-present**
SANTA BARBARA, CA (formerly in Los Angeles, CA 1995-1999)

Work with individuals (22-26/week) in a therapeutic setting for recovery from injuries/stress. Close work with local chiropractors for continuity of care. Use techniques including deep tissue, trigger point, prenatal techniques, and Reiki. Perform natural health consultations to assist clients in making gentle changes towards better health. Also work as a birth assistant. 
<u>Selected as a "Best Practice" by Massage Magazine for 2006 AND 2007</u>

**Santa Barbara Business College, Faculty, September 2007 - June 2008**
SANTA BARBARA, CA 
Instructor for <u>Pathology for Massage</u>, <u>Nutrition for Fitness</u> and <u>Introduction to Nutrition</u>. Tasks involve lecture, class planning, grading, exam design and research. 

**Massage Therapist/Chiropractic Assistant, 2001-2003**
DR'S CRAVIOTTO, DAWSON AND WAGNER, DC's

Work closely with chiropractors on treatment of their patients. Use primarily deep tissue and trigger point work. Active charting with SOAP notes and doctor conferences.  

**Massage Therapist/Physical Therapy Aide, 2001**
SANTA BARBARA INDUSTRIAL MEDICAL CENTER, PHYSICAL THERAPY DEPARTMENT

Promote healing of pre and post op patients with various work-related injuries including low back strain, carpal tunnel, tendonitis, and knee and shoulder problems. Work directly with physicians, communication using SOAP notes. Utilize a variety of therapeutic options: massage, e-stim, heat packs, ice massage, stretching and weight training, ultrasound and paraffin dips.
fields.training_and_education:
2007- January 2009  **Clayton College of Natural Health**.  <u>M.S. in Natural Health.</u>  Curriculum included Nutrition, Biology, Cancer Treatment, Anatomy, Holistic Development, Healing Relationships, Homeopathy for Animals, Psychospiritual Health, Herb/Vitamin/Mineral/RX interaction, Personal Environment, Mind/Body Wellness. Currently pursuing a Ph.D. in Natural Health.

2008 **Comprehensive Nutrition Training. Crayhon Research**. <u>16 hours of lecture</u>
on latest nutritional breakthroughs, eating and supplements for disease, politics of food, autoimmune disorders, gastrointestinal health, weight loss.

2008 **American Naturopath Medical Association Convention**. <u>26 hours of lecture</u>
on various topics such as Nutrition for Stress, Fingernail and Tongue Analysis, Chronic Pain, Iridology, Food and Disease, Carpal Tunnel Syndrome (non-surgical treatments), Client Communication, Inflammation, Cancer Therapies, Skin disorders, Legal Concerns and CPR *Certification with the American Heart Assoc*. 

June 2008 **Food First Seminar with Crayhon Research**.  <u>6 hour lecture</u> on latest nutritional research and special diets for treating disease. 

March 2008 **Food First Seminar with Crayhon Research**.  <u>6 hour lecture</u> on latest nutritional research and health. 

2006-2007  **Clayton College of Natural Health**.  <u>**Doctor of Naturopathy for Health Care Professionals.**</u> Highest Honors. Curriculum included Herbology, Iridology, Homeopathy, Diet, Cleansing and Nutrition, Mind-body medicine, Practicum and Assessment techniques. 

2007 **Energetic Kinesiology and Muscle Testing**. <u>8 hours.</u> Work with kinesiology to assess conditions and recommend natural remedies. 

2007 **American Naturopath Medical Association Convention**. <u>26 hours of lecture</u> on various topics such as Cell Healing, Nutrition, Whole Foods, Minerals, Iridology, Detoxification, Children's Nutrition, Natural Pain Relief, Hormones, Emotional Medicine, Heart Disease, and Color Healing. Special workshops in Probiotics, Energy Balancing, Pain Relief and Intestinal Disorders.

2007  **Healing And the Childbearing Year** Central Coast Doula Association Conference featuring Penny Simkin. Childhood Sexual Abuse and its effect on childbearing, Postpartum care, Infant care, Healing Remedies for the childbearing year. 

2007  **Dr's Gaby and Wright Nutrition and Disease Lecture** <u>4 day lecture</u>
addressing every vitamin, mineral, enzyme and amino acid and information on nutrition for over 300 diseases and disorders. 

2006  **American Naturopath Medical Association Convention** <u>26 hours of lecture</u> on various topics such as Nutrition, Mind-body medicine, Herbs, Chinese Medicine, Breath work, Homeopathics, Cancer, Depression and Diabetes education. 

2006  **Clayton College of Natural Health**. <u>Certificate of Natural Wellness</u> Highest Honors, Curriculum included Nutrition, Mind-Body Medicine, Alternative Practices, Holistic Lifestyles, and Energy Techniques.

2004-2005 **Stratford Career Institute**  <u>Natural Health Consultant Program</u>, Honors, Curriculum included Herbs, Homeopathy, Smoking Cessation, Diet, Exercise, Health Counseling and Digestive Health Issues.  

2003  Medical Massage Certification **LMTSuccessGroup**, <u>45 hour program</u> 
with training in Postural Distortion, Back Conditions, Cervical Conditions, Arm and Leg Disorders, Insurance Billing and Healing with E-Stim. 

2001  Training and Certification **SB School of Massage**, <u>200 hour program</u>
with training in Swedish, Sports, Shiatsu, On-site Chair, Chiropractic Massage, Pregnancy, Myofascial Release, Deep Tissue, Polarity Balancing, Anatomy and Ethics and Business. 

1995  Training and Certification **School of Massage**, Encino, CA. <u>75 hour program</u> with training in Swedish, Deep Tissue, Anatomy and Ethics.

1990 <u>3 years</u> **Private Study** with <u>Pat Mauro</u>, LMT, RN, EMT; Pittsburgh, PA. Training in Deep Tissue, Body Manipulation, Herbs, and Intuitive Massage 

1988-1992 **Point Park University**, Pittsburgh, PA  <u>BFA theatre, Minor in Psychology</u>, graduated Cum Laude

<u>Reiki Certification</u> to **Master Level** with Diane Vaughn RM, Venice, CA. 
I have taught group as well as individual classes and perform healings and attunements.

<u>Further/Self-Study</u> in Pet Massage, Sports Massage, Myofascial Release, Polarity Therapy, Lymphatic Drainage and Acupressure/Trigger Point, Mind/Body Healing, Magnetics, Anatomy, pH, Assessment and Palpation Techniques, Medical Terms.
